reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a spacious room with a super large but far too soft bed, so we woke up with bad backs. We overlooked the river. Be aware that some rooms are only part en-suite, in other words you have to go down the corridor for the loo and bath. Ours was fully en-suite although there was a strange arrangement with the loo in one cupboard, and the shower in another. Good to have an iron and ironing board in the room, and a flat-screen TV.
reviews.title: Lovely situation, pub chain food, cheap accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Food was typical chain food, which you have to order at the bar, reasonable in price but nothing special. With over 100 tables for diners inside and out into the gardens, some of them 6 seaters, one wonders how they cope on a busier night, than when we were there midweek with cold weather.
reviews.title: Too busy for its own good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After an appetite inducing walk along the riverbank which can be accessed directly through the river fronting pub garden we were ready to eat and were looking forward to eating lunch at this large and picturesque pub.
reviews.title: Nice food but badly understaffed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outside tables were busy and we should have read the warning signals - uncleared tables and empty glasses (and clouds of wasps). Nonetheless we ploughed on and ordered from the set menu, three courses for £9.95 which seemed pretty good value for money. I overheard one member of staff saying there was a 40 minute wait so I enquired whether this was right, yes, apparently so.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I therefore opted, in the interests of being able to leave before nightfall for everything to come together which was suggested by the member of bar staff who was serving me. It was a bit weird but would save us from the 1 hour wait which I was advised might be the case if we followed convention and had starters and then mains.
reviews.title: Went the extra mile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: After waiting an hour we grabbed a rude waitress to ask where our wedges were, she came back with a dish of black, cold wedges. She didnt say a word, no apology. They were soon sent back to the kitchen. 20 minute queue for a drink. Abysmal
reviews.title: An hour for cold wedges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Lovely hot summer evening, lots of outdoor seating - you would have thought they would have had more staff - wrong! Instead of having one section for food ordering and one for the bar, it was just one big jumbled mess resulting in a queue out of the door. We waited an hour and 20 minutes for what turned out to be a truly terrible meal that had no taste and looked like it had been thrown on the plate. Lots of angry customers, not enough poor harrased staff, no sign of the Manager. Live local to this pub and have been going there for many years but it has truly gone downhill and I won't be back.
reviews.title: Shambolic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The day previous to my visit to the Rose Revived, I visited The Manse at Bourton on the Water for a meal and was shocked to find they were charging £2.85 for a small flat Blackcurrant and lemonade. We had a meal at the Rose Revived nothing special and one of our guests ordered a lager and lime with a little extra lime, again their pricing kicked in and charged £1.30 for two splashes of lime, how can that pricing be justified, I think we spent about £120 on meals, and yes the Rose Revived is owned by the same Company that owns the Manse. I shall not revisit.
reviews.title: RIP OFF PRICING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited late afternoon for a break on a long drive. The location of the pub is superb, right on the thames, delightful on a sunny afternoon. Had to wait a long time at the bar for anyone to appear. Was just about to leave when a waiter turned up. We had coffees and cake and the cake portion was generous and a very good cake it was too.
reviews.title: long wait for service but location makes up for it
Location isn't everything.
reviews.text: Having queued for 20 minutes to order a drink, I was told there was an hour and a half wait for food and if we hadn't booked they could not serve us at all. Staff attitude was terrible, tables were dirty and the pub totally understaffed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had passed by several times and thought how lovely it looked, but as the old saying goes 'never judge a book by its cover'. The vegetables and potato/chips served with our main meals were, at best, luke warm, although the meat option was hot. My bread & butter pudding chosen from the 'Specials' board was luke warm at the edge and frozen in the middle. This was return to the kitchen by a waitress who did not keep us informed of what was happening to my dessert. After having to ask and a 10 minute wait a replacement pudding arrived, which this time was frozen throughout and served with the now runny ice-cream from my first dessert. I asked for a refund, but after much deliberation with another member of staff the waitress informed me that I should have another pudding as she had taken the other out of the microwave too soon! Having insisted on a refund I was told it was being dealt with. After 15 minutes and no refund I asked for my refund at the bar where after a lot of fuss and no apology it was given. We shall not be returning.
reviews.title: Cold Veg & Icy Pudding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We spent the night at the Rose Revived on our walk from the mouth of the Thames to its source. The Rose Revived is a traditional pub with rooms. The location is spectacular beside the river and by an old bridge.
reviews.title: A good place to stop on the Thames path walk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Dinner was traditional pub food and good value with two main courses costing £9.95 (under £5 per head!) The haddock was good and the surroundings excellent. We ate outside on a warm evening. Rooms were eccentric but quite clean and reasonable value at £75 B&B for two. Breakfast was also traditional and pretty good. There was a good choice of beer.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went with friends for their anniversary, even though it was early evening (17.45) upon ordering we found numerous items unavailable.However, It was ok for myself & friend, as our choice was available and was put through the till but our wives had to choose something else. So after asking for their second choice and going back to the order point, the person who served us had now moved on to another customer. We eventually ordered the other 2 meals but these arrived 15 minutes after the first 2! I must say the meals looked like they had sat under a heat lamp and were very poor quality. Hence, we ate up & left asap. I did mention the delay in meals when paying, only to receive a 'sorry about that' Did originally want to sit outside but the area was extremely tidy with litter everywhere.
reviews.title: nice location but basic food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the location beside the thames is excellent.we had the two meals for 9.95 .the haddock bake &gammon with two fried eggs was value but let down by the peas being cold and over cooked. if you dont mind queuing to put in your food order and in no rush for your food its the surrounds that make up for the basic food and service .its handy for going for a walk along the thames path afterwards and with the food being improved it could be much better due to the setting.
reviews.title: excellent shared lunch...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On on Thames Walk we stayed overnight here and had a lovely stay. Breakfast was very good, even if the wait staff was a bit untalkative. Overall though, a very nice place to stay and rest your weary bones after a long walk or have a pint along the river. The location is incredible.
reviews.title: Fantastic location for a drink on the Thames!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My only complaint was that the food in the pub wasn't fantastic. Good, but nothing like some of the other pubs we've eaten at along the way and the pub was lacking a bit of character (suggestion to owners: light the fires, bring down the lights and turn off the music for a more cozy pub feel).
reviews.title: Couldn't fault an overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice bar with good wine and very pleasant atmosphere. Food is OK. Huge menu. generous portions. It's good pub food but nothing amazing.
reviews.title: Great overnight stay and family meal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: Our room was warm, comfortable, quiet and clean. Slept really well with the window open listening to the odd car from the main road and the swans.
reviews.title: The perfect Christmas
disappointing
reviews.text: There's nothing fancy here, but excellent value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Decided to eat out on Christmas day for the
reviews.title: Scrummy platter for two after a morning walking !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: we have visited here before and in thepast the food has been good. However my husband and I had two main courses for £5. The plate with the fish was burnt around the edges although the meal was fine. The peas were hard and the potatoes overheated and inedible. We ordered some chips and most of those were hard. Our friends had sandwichdes and the ham was very good quality but the brown bread was stale, white o.k. Their chips were hard too.
reviews.title: mediocre meal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will not be returning.
reviews.title: Great venue for good food at right price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have visited The Rose Revived on a number of occasions to eat in the restaurant both at lunchtime and in the evening. We have always find the food well cooked and presented, the staff are friendly and obliging and the prices very satisfying. Yesterday we revisited for lunch and were not disappointed. Alex looked after us and he was most courteous, polite and friendly. We will certainly go back.
reviews.title: A great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed while walking the Thames Path. It is situated on the River, and has a brilliant location. An en-suite room wasn't available, but we had a bathroom opposite our room so it was not a problem. Staff were friendly and the typical pub food good & cheap.
reviews.title: Picturesque location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Rose Revived Inn is picturesquely situated by the Thames at Newbridge and was ideally located for our night's stay whilst walking the Thames Path. Our room (No. 6, I think, overlooking the river) was adequate. The bed was comfortable but the shower was pathetic and the toilet had a noisy macerating system.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arriving at 5.30pm on Friday 21st June, we finally finished our one course meal at 8.00!
reviews.title: Don't!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was abysmal, worst we have experienced for a very long time. The pub was
reviews.title: Very good value meal in a lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: dirty, disorganised (waiting in queues for drinks, food, bill took over 45 mins) and hopelessly
reviews.title: Atrocious!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: inefficient. When the food finally arrived, it was of poor quality - a case of spot the scampi
reviews.title: Great location, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: within the breaded shell! Of three apparently different real ales, the house beer was clearly
reviews.title: warm and friendly
Could Be So Much Better !
reviews.text: I stayed at Rose Revived with two friends whilst walking part of the nearby Thames Path. We were attracted to Rose Revived due to its excellent location literally next to the River Thames but unfortunately we were very disappointed with the accommodation provided. Whilst we accept that it is an older building, and therefore it can be difficult to provide accommodation that meets many guests expectations, what was on offer was, quite frankly, poor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a twin room with no en suite and a nearby double room, with an en suite shower room. Whilst the rooms were clean and the beds comfortable, the other furnishings were generally worn and tired, and the decoration was bland with wood chipped ceiling paper and white painted walls. The real disappointment was the bathroom facilities. The en suite for the double room consisted of two small rooms, no larger than walk in wardrobes, one containing a single wc and the other a shower cubicle. There was a wash hand basin in a chipped and battered vanitory unit located in the corner of the bedroom.
reviews.title: Late lunchtime experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The twin room was small with a similar quality of furnishings, and also had a wash hand basin. The room was across the hall from a shared bathroom, which provided a single wc and a bath. The fittings were very dated and in our opinion are long overdue for replacement. The absence of a wash hand basin in the bath room was also not ideal.
reviews.title: Picturesque

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Turning now to the food. I am pleased to say that we were very happy with both our evening meal and breakfast. The staff were friendly and polite, but in our opinion the bar could be more efficently run, as whilst there seemed to be plenty of staff, more often or not there were also a number of people waiting to be served.
reviews.title: Disapointed ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With some thought and investment in respect of the bed and breakfast accommodation, this could become a great place to stay, and one that would live up to its great location.
reviews.title: Is that what you call en-suite?
